overview_of_class: This course provides an introduction to the basic concepts of statistics. Throughout the course, students will learn to: summarize data using graphs and tables; explain/calculate descriptive statistics, confidence intervals, correlation, regression, and probability; and explain tests of significance and data-production including sampling and experiments. Basic knowledge of algebra is recommended.
name: Introduction to Statistics
title: SCS STAT 202-CN-12 Introduction to Statistics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course provides an introduction to the basic concepts of statistics. Throughout the course, students will learn to: summarize data using graphs and tables; explain/calculate descriptive statistics, confidence intervals, correlation, regression, and probability; and explain tests of significance and data-production including sampling and experiments. Basic knowledge of algebra is recommended.

subject: STAT

overview_of_class: This course covers data collection and summary, random variables, correlation, regression, probability, sampling, estimation, tests of significance, and two-sample comparisons. Does not require calculus and makes minimal use of formal mathematics. Examples are taken from newspapers and other real-world sources. Familiarity with Microsoft Excel is recommended. The computer is used as a tool to enhance students' ability to analyze and interpret data collected. This course combines classroom lecture and discussion with an online component.
name: Introduction to Statistics
title: SCS STAT 202-CN-17 Introduction to Statistics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers data collection and summary, random variables, correlation, regression, probability, sampling, estimation, tests of significance, and two-sample comparisons. Does not require calculus and makes minimal use of formal mathematics. Examples are taken from newspapers and other real-world sources. Familiarity with Microsoft Excel is recommended. The computer is used as a tool to enhance students' ability to analyze and interpret data collected. This course combines classroom lecture and discussion with an online component.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: For the lecture and discussion components, this course is paired with an afternoon session of COMM ST 360-CN taught by Daniel Moser and will meet on alternate Saturdays: 4/2, 4/16, 4/30, 5/14, 6/4. For the online component, students must have ready access to the Internet. Enrollment is this course is limited to BLP year one students only. First class attendance is mandatory.

subject: STAT
